title: The Fission Cross Sections Of Plutonium-239 And  Plutonium-242 Relative To Uranium-235 From 0.1 To  10 Mev

freetext: Corrected for:
- second 7Li(p,n) group,
- 7Li and d break-up neutrons,
- scattering in detector and neutron source assembly,
- pulse-height distribution below bias level.
Sample geometry differences eliminated by measurements
in both detector orientations.
Momentum effects reduced by same procedure.
Corrections made for remaining momentum effects,
deposit thickness and fragment angular distributions.
Background from (d,n) reactions with gas target
assembly measured with empty gas cell.
Samples back-to-back in low mass double
ionization chamber using methane as counter gas
placed 5 cm from neutron source.
Argonne 8 MeV Tandem Dynamitron
for below En~5 MeV
Targets produced by evaporation of Li on Ta backing.
Target thicknesses about 200 keV above 2 MeV neutron
energy but thinner at lower energies.
for above En~5 MeV
Deuterium gas in a 2-cm-long cell filled to 2 atm.
Pulsed beam and fast timing used to reduce and
measure time independent background
